. _________ loops through a piece of code as long as the condition indicated is assessed to be correct

__________ changes the loop counter with a new value. It assesses at the end of each iteration.
__________ assign to initialize the counter variables and assess once unconditionally before the first execution of the body of the loop.

__________ within the starting of each iteration, the condition is assessed. On the off chance that it is assessed to be true, the loop proceeds, and the nested statements are executed. If it assesses to be wrong, the execution of the loop will end.

item.question: to help you find and work with your data.
There are two ways of PHP-MySQL connection and what are they?
item.choice1: A. the MySQLi extension and the BDO
item.choice2: B. the MySQLi extension and the ODP
item.choice3: C. the MySQLi extension and the OOP
item.choice4: D. the MySQLi extension and the PDO
item.answer: D. the MySQLi extension and the PDO

item.question: The VALUES identifies?
item.choice1: A. values to be inserted in the table.
item.choice2: B. values to be deleted in the table.
item.choice3: C. values to be copied in the table.
item.choice4: D. values to be duplicated in the table.
item.answer: A. values to be inserted in the table.

item.question: It defines the username in myqli_connect() parameters.
It defines the user's password in myqli_connect() parameters.
It defines the database in myqli_connect() parameters.
Which is correct about DELETE Statement?
item.choice1: A. Omitting the WHERE clause in DELETE Statement will delete all rows.
item.choice2: B. All rows removed on a table by a DELETE Statement are in an archive.
item.choice3: C. If the target column in the WHERE clause of a DELETE Statement is not UNIQUE, it will cause to remove more than on record.
item.choice4: D. The DELETE Statement always requires the WHERE clause.
item.answer: A. Omitting the WHERE clause in DELETE Statement will delete all rows.

item.question: Which of the following is a correct step in adding data to a MySQL database table using the MySQLi extension in PHP?
item.choice1: A. Creating an HTML form to collect the user input
item.choice2: B. Executing a SELECT query to retrieve the data from the database
item.choice3: C. Opening a connection to the database using the mysqli_connect() function
item.choice4: D. Passing the data to the mysqli_fetch_array() function to store it in the database table.
item.answer: C. Opening a connection to the database using the mysqli_connect() function

Which is correct about MySQLi extension and PDO?
item.choice1: A. MySQLi extension provides both Object-Oriented and Procedural.
item.choice2: B. MySQLi extension only works in MySQL.
item.choice3: C. PDO works in different DBMS.
item.choice4: D. Only PDO provides Prepared Statements.
item.answer: A. MySQLi extension provides both Object-Oriented and Procedural.

item.question: PDO requires this line of code to close the database connection.

Which is correct about the PDO structure?
item.choice1: A. The function connect_error() is used to check if the program is connected to a database.
item.choice2: B. The function execute() is used to execute the query held by a variable.
item.choice3: C. The function exec() is used because there are no results returned by a program.
item.choice4: D. The function error() is used to return the program error's details.
item.answer: B. The function execute() is used to execute the query held by a variable.
